net.corda.flows

Class TwoPartyDealFlow.Secondary<U>

  • FlowLogic
    • net.corda.flows.TwoPartyDealFlow.Secondary<U>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TwoPartyDealFlow.Acceptor
    Enclosing class:
    TwoPartyDealFlow

    public static class TwoPartyDealFlow.Secondary<U>
extends FlowLogic

    Abstracted bilateral deal flow participant that is recipient of initial communication.

    There's a good chance we can push at least some of this logic down into core flow logic and helper methods etc.

      SignedTransaction call()

      Party getOtherParty() 
      ProgressTracker getProgressTracker()
      Override this to provide a class ProgressTracker. If one is provided and stepped, the framework will do something helpful with the progress reports. If this flow is invoked as a subflow of another, then the tracker will be made a child of the current step in the parent. If it's null, this flow doesn't track progress.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Secondary

        public Secondary(ProgressTracker progressTracker)

        Abstracted bilateral deal flow participant that is recipient of initial communication.

        There's a good chance we can push at least some of this logic down into core flow logic and helper methods etc.

        Parameters:
        progressTracker -

        Override this to provide a class ProgressTracker. If one is provided and stepped, the framework will do something helpful with the progress reports. If this flow is invoked as a subflow of another, then the tracker will be made a child of the current step in the parent. If it's null, this flow doesn't track progress.

        Note that this has to return a tracker before the flow is invoked. You can't change your mind half way through.

      • Secondary

        public Secondary()

        Abstracted bilateral deal flow participant that is recipient of initial communication.

        There's a good chance we can push at least some of this logic down into core flow logic and helper methods etc.

    • Method Detail

      • getOtherParty

        public Party getOtherParty()

        public SignedTransaction call()

        This is where you fill out your business logic. The returned object will usually be ignored, but can be helpful if this flow is meant to be used as a subflow.

      • getProgressTracker

        public ProgressTracker getProgressTracker()

        Override this to provide a class ProgressTracker. If one is provided and stepped, the framework will do something helpful with the progress reports. If this flow is invoked as a subflow of another, then the tracker will be made a child of the current step in the parent. If it's null, this flow doesn't track progress.

        Note that this has to return a tracker before the flow is invoked. You can't change your mind half way through.

        See Also:
        class ProgressTracker
